headline: Lennar (LEN) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of homebuilder Lennar (NYSE:LEN) jumped 4.3% in the morning session after a regulatory filing revealed that famed investor Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway had taken a significant new stake in the homebuilder. The move is seen by investors as a major vote of confidence from the legendary investor in the U.S. housing market. headline: Wall Street trains sights on Jackson Hole Fed gathering
summary: (Reuters) -Investors will next week train their sights on Jackson Hole, Wyoming, where Federal Reserve policymakers gather for their annual policy symposium, in a search for clues on the path of interest rate cuts that could boost stocks to more record highs.  This year's gathering follows a week in which consumer and wholesale price data appeared to send mixed signals about how well the economy is weathering U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping import tariffs.  Its climax will be on Friday, when Fed Chair Jerome Powell is scheduled to speak following what will have been a data-light week.

headline: Applied Materials, Buffett's Lennar & DR Horton stake, Nubank
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) stock falls after the company issued guidance that fell short of Wall Street's expectations. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B, BRK-A) added to its stakes in homebuilder stocks Lennar (LEN) and DR Horton (DHI). Nu Holding (NU) stock surges after the company reported Nubank's strong customer credit quality. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Warren Buffett Bets On Nucor, UnitedHealth, Housing; Apple Stake Pared
summary: Warren Buffett has added new positions in Nucor and UnitedHealth Group, while shedding more shares of Apple and Bank of America, the quarterly Form 13-F filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission revealed late yesterday.  Buffett also established a new position in homebuilder D.R. Horton, while adding a much bigger stake in Lennar.  Lamar Advertising, another new pickup for Berkshire Hathaway, also rose.
